name: renderlet
headline: Build interactive applications that run anywhere
description:
renderlet is a framework that makes it easy to develop interactive applications.

Building applications with high-performance graphics is very hard – existing tools are cumbersome and aren’t truly platform agnostic, leading to frequent rework. 

With renderlet, developers can write high-level code to describe 2D and 3D graphics without having to use low-level, platform-specific APIs.

renderlet automatically compiles graphics code to WebAssembly and embeds a portable rendering engine inside any app, enabling graphics to safely and automatically render on any platform’s GPU.

Our runtime is open-source: https://github.com/renderlet/wander

founders.name: Sean Isom, Founder
founders.description: Sean is the Founder of renderlet. He previously built Developer Platforms at Adobe as a Lead Engineer and Sr. Engineering Manager, building the core infrastructure that powers apps like Photoshop and Acrobat. He has over a decade of technical experience in browsertech and real-time graphics and is currently involved in standardization efforts for WebAssembly’s WASI GPU support.

# Write graphics code once, automatically run on any platform.
Renderlet is a WebAssembly framework for writing graphics code that runs anywhere.

# Developers can use renderlet to embed GPU-accelerated 2D and 3D graphics into cross-platform applications.
![Image of renderlet code and its resulting 3D image](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65ecaf67253cc0b11bba5085/65efa511f9b9da86a1c586bb_demo.png)
## What is renderlet?
With renderlet, **we compile graphics to portable WebAssembly modules** and provide a runtime that abstracts away the underlying GPU architecture to the code.
  * A **compiler** that takes a high-level specification of your graphics pipeline, any assets, custom functions, and libraries, and builds self-contained WebAssembly modules.
  * A **rendering engine** , _wander_ , that embeds into any application, on any platform, that safely runs the renderlet modules with the platform’s GPU.
  * A **visual editor** that makes it easy to compile graphics and visualization pipelines out of reusable modules.


[![renderlet logo in white](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65ecaf67253cc0b11bba5085/65ef79b686d223142ce8e406_renderlet-white-svg.svg)](http://renderlet.com/<#>)
[![Twitter logo](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65ecaf67253cc0b11bba5085/65ef7beca3599cd79e341b61_twitter.svg)](http://renderlet.com/<https:/twitter.com/theisomizer>)[![Linkedin logo](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65ecaf67253cc0b11bba5085/65ef7bec685dc4979bc57ae8_LinkedIn.svg)](http://renderlet.com/<https:/www.linkedin.com/search/results/all/?fetchDeterministicClustersOnly=true&heroEntityKey=urn%3Ali%3Afsd_profile%3AACoAAAs6adgBX9hYg3Fv9MCbq2PN4KEHnZ7lafA&keywords=sean%20isom&origin=RICH_QUERY_TYPEAHEAD_HISTORY&position=0&searchId=8f8cbf03-0501-4170-939b-3d9ee567145d&sid=EHw&spellCorrectionEnabled=true>)[![Github logo](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/65ecaf67253cc0b11bba5085/65ef7bec4638b2e3b223732a_github.svg)](http://renderlet.com/<https:/github.com/renderlet/wander>)

generated_description:
**Renderlet: Empowering Interactive Graphics Development**

Founded in 2024 and part of Y Combinator Batch W24, Renderlet is changing the game for developers looking to create interactive applications. Based in New York, this nimble startup, currently a team of two, focuses on building a framework that simplifies the development of high-performance graphics across platforms. With Jared Friedman as their Group Partner, they tackle one of the persistent headaches in app development: creating graphics that work seamlessly on any device without the constant hassle of refactoring.

So, what’s the core of Renderlet’s offering? Well, it's all about convenience and versatility. Traditional graphics development typically requires deep dives into low-level, platform-specific APIs, which can be not only cumbersome but also exceedingly time-consuming. Renderlet abstracts away these complexities, allowing developers to write high-level code for 2D and 3D graphics that compiles automatically into WebAssembly. This means that developers can focus on building their applications rather than getting bogged down in syntax and platform quirks.

At the heart of Renderlet is a couple of game-changing components:
1. **A Compiler**: This takes your high-level descriptions—think your graphics pipelines and custom functions—and packages them into self-contained WebAssembly modules. 
2. **Wander**: This is the rendering engine that gets embedded into any app across platforms, leveraging the underlying GPU for optimal performance.

The best part? The Renderlet runtime is open source, available on [GitHub](https://github.com/renderlet/wander), allowing the community to contribute and grow this innovative tool further.

If you're a developer tired of the old grind of cross-platform graphic development, Renderlet offers a fresh perspective with a genuinely promising framework. You can check out their website at [renderlet.com](http://renderlet.com) for documentation and further insights into how they can help you embed GPU-accelerated graphics into your applications effortlessly.

In a nutshell, Renderlet is about building interactive applications that work anywhere—with fewer headaches and much more speed. Join their journey to streamline graphics development and unleash the potential of your projects!
